From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To close an active terminal session by logging off the router, use the **exit** command in EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: In the following example, the exit (global) command is used to move from global configuration mode to privileged EXEC mode, the disable command is used to move from privileged EXEC mode to user EXEC mode, and the exit (EXEC) command is used to log off (exit the active session):
ExtraInfo: Use the **exit** command in EXEC mode to exit the active session (log off the device). This command can be used in any EXEC mode (such as User EXEC mode or Privileged EXEC mode) to exit from the EXEC process.

RelatedCmds.description: Ends your configuration session by exiting to EXEC mode.
Exits from the current configuration mode to the next highest configuration mode.
Closes your connection to the device (equivilant to the **exit** command).
